summary: This bill, the Securing America’s Ports of Entry Act of 2025, aims to increase the number of U.S. Customs and Border Protection officers and support staff. It mandates the hiring of at least 1,000 new officers annually and outlines requirements for calculating staffing needs based on traffic forecasts. The bill also requires reports on infrastructure improvements, detection and safety equipment related to opioid interdiction at ports of entry, quarterly reports on temporary duty assignments, and updates on staffing models and agreements. Finally, establishes requirements for reports from the Government Accountability Office (GAO) if hiring targets are not met.
